temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph.order
Class TopSorter

java.lang.Object
  temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph.search.DFS.Visitor
      temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph.order.TopSorter
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, Algorithm, Filtering
public class TopSorter
extends DFS.Visitor
implements Algorithm, Filtering

Topological sorter.

A topological sort of a directed graph is an ordering of the nodes in the graph such that if node u precedes nodes v in the order, then u is not reachable from v.

Topological sorting is a useful component for producing a serial order which respects the constraints imposed by a partial order. As a side effect, topological sorting checks whether or not a graph is acyclic. A cyclic graph produces an invalid sort, which can be determined by the valid method.

Topological sorting is implemented as a straightforward application of DFS.

topSortNumbers

public static IntNodeMap topSortNumbers(Graph g)
Produce an attribute map with topological numbers.

Parameters:
g - the graph whose topological numbering is found.
Returns:
an attribute map m associating a number with every node in g such that m(n) < m(n') implies that n' cannot reach n in g.
